answer:
For best protection, it is recommended that children adhere as closely as possible to the recommended schedule.
Postponing the 4 month vaccination leaves your son at risk for disease longer and at a time when he is most vulnerable.  It may be possible to have his vaccinations done in the place you are traveling to. Bring his immunization records with you and contact the local public health unit there.
We recommend that you follow up with your immunizing health care provider who can make a recommendation for your child.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## For best protection, it is recommended that children adhere as closely as possible to the recommended schedule.


## Postponing the 4 month vaccination leaves your son at risk for disease longer and at a time when he is most vulnerable.

It may be possible to have his vaccinations done in the place you are traveling to.
Bring his immunization records with you and contact the local public health unit there.
We recommend that you follow up with your immunizing health care provider who can make a recommendation for your child.
Immunization Nurse
question: My son was born at Feb 21st, 2017. He had his two month vaccine. But he is currently leaving and will come back in August. So he missed his four month vaccine. What should do then
question_variation_0: can i miss vaccine on my child when leaving
question_variation_1: vaccination missed vaccines how to fix
question_variation_2: what to do if a baby has missed his 4 month vaccine
